titlestmt.titleproper: HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Faculty and Staff, 1908-2005: A Finding Aid

titlepage.titleproper: HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Faculty and Staff, 1908-2005: A Finding Aid
titlepage.author: Baker Library
titlepage.p: Â© 2008 President and Fellows of Harvard College

did.unittitle: HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Faculty and Staff, 1908-2005

physdesc.extent: 47 boxes, 2 oversize boxes, and 14 mapcase folders

did.abstract: Photographs of faculty and staff of Harvard Business School.

processinfo.p: By: Terry Long and Rachel Wise

accessrestrict.p: Appointment necessary to consult collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Faculty and Staff. Baker Library Historical Collections. Harvard Business School.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available:
altformavail.p: Portions of the collection have been scanned and are available through VIA: http://via.harvard.edu

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Harvard Business School was founded in 1908. In the early years many of the faculty members were both traditional academics and "real-world practitioners" recruited from industries to teach at the business school. From the 1920s through the 1950s, many of the new faculty came from HBS MBA and doctoral programs. In addition to teaching and conducting research at HBS, faculty are actively engaged with many outside activities such as serving on boards of directors and as presidents of professional research membership societies, receiving awards, and presenting speeches and lectures. The staff at HBS have been involved in the daily operation of the school as well as conducted research with faculty members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note:
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of photographs of HBS faculty, HBS staff and research fellows. Faculty photographs include many portraits as well as photographs of teaching in classrooms, speaking at various events, social life, researching in faculty offices, and other images documenting the daily activities of HBS faculty.

Staff photographs consist mostly of portraits and also include photographs of staff working in offices and socializing. The collection includes photographs of HBS departments, including the Bureau of Business Research and the Division of Research (later named the Division of Research and Faculty Development), the Audio-Visual department, the Written Analysis of Cases (WAC) graders, and the Office of the Dean and faculty support staff at Morgan Hall, among other departments.
The collection also includes portraits of individuals who have received fellowships at HBS; and portraits of individuals who are affiliated with HBS including donors such as George F. Baker.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections:
relatedmaterial.p: The Faculty and Staff photographs are part of the HBS Archives Photograph Collections. Additional photograph collections include:

item.extref: HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Student Life
HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Buildings and Grounds
HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Executive Education Programs
HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Subject Files and Events
HBS Archives Photograph Collection: Wartime Schools

arrangement.head: Series Outline
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in the following series:

list.item:
Series I. Faculty Photographs, 1908-2005
Subseries A. Faculty Photographs, A-Z, 1908-2005
Subseries B. Group Faculty Photographs, 1940s-circa 1990
Subseries C. Unidentified Faculty, circa 1940-circa 2000

Series II. Staff Photographs, 1940-2001
Subseries A. Alphabetical, A-Z, circa 1940-circa 1994
Subseries B. Unidentified Individuals and Contact Sheets, 1940-1989
Subseries C. Departments, A-Z, circa 1922-1980s
Series III. HBS Fellows, A-Z, circa 1954-1994

scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of faculty members at Harvard Business School. These include full time and visiting faculty from 1908 through the present day, and a few photographs of Harvard University faculty. The photographs document many activities of HBS faculty including teaching, speaking at conferences and other occasions, visiting companies to obtain cases, working in faculty offices, and socializing. Many of the photographs are black and white portraits used for HBS publications. Also included are some photographs of portrait paintings. The Faculty Photographs series has been divided into three subseries, faculty photographs arranged alphabetically; faculty groups arranged chronologically, and unidentified faculty arranged chronologically.

When it is not evident from the folder title, selected individual folders have a scope and content note to further describe the contents of the folder. Individual faculty members often appear in other faculty members photographs. This has also been noted in folder scope and content notes

processinfo.p: Contact sheets not listed on the finding aid. They have been filed after a folder of photographs of specific faculty member.

scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of photographs of groups of faculty, some posed on steps, many at meetings in various places on campus. Included are casual photographs of faculty playing poker, at dinners, or attending other social events. This subseries includes general group photographs and also group photographs organized by teaching department. Faculty members represented include Malcolm P. McNair, Stanley F. Teele, Donald K. David, among many others.

did.unittitle: Groups- Faculty Club at Morgan Hall, 1949

scopecontent.p: Photographs of faculty poker game, including Malcolm P. McNair at poker table.

scopecontent.p: Contains small headshots of faculty mounted onto sheets of paper in alphabetical order.
This subseries consists of various individual unidentified faculty members. Includes portraits, and photographs of faculty teaching in the classroom, in offices and on campus.

did.unittitle: Unidentified- On cover of Purchasing magazine, 12 June 1969

scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of HBS staff and includes portraits, photographs of staff working in offices, and staff socializing. The series has been arranged into three subseries: an alphabetical list of staff members, unidentified staff members, and group photographs of HBS departments.

This subseries consists of individual HBS staff members arranged alphabetically. When possible, department affiliation has been identified as well as research assistants and research associates. Note that research associates and assistants were often MBA graduates and doctoral candidates.

Subseries B. Unidentified Individual Staff and Contact Sheets, 1940-1989

scopecontent.p: This series consists of group photographs of HBS administrative departments. The photographs show the functions of various offices and show departments at various HBS events. Included in this subseries are photographs of the Bureau of Business Research, the Written Analysis of Cases (WAC) graders, and the Audio-Visual department filming for case research.

did.unittitle: Audio-Visual Department- Filming Athena Electronics case study, 1958

scopecontent.p: Staff album originally compiled by Lorna Daniells in 1985 with additional photographs added between 1985-1992. Contains photographs of Baker Library staff dating from 1950-1992 with annotations by Lorna Daniells. Photographs depict various staff events such as parties and trainings as well as staff at work.
Includes photographs from the National Shoe Retailers Association annual meeting, 1923.

scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of individuals affiliated with HBS but who are not faculty, fellows, staff or alumni.

accessrestrict.p: Permission to publish must be obtained by the Karsh estate. Contact Archivist for details.
